messages: aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:21): solves mjs by adding an Macie_J_Stachowiak to the present list..
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:39): kicks dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:39): you actually scribed both sicking and timeless as JS in the same meeting!
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:39): hi sicking
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (22:40): gets himself off the floor
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (22:40): goes back to coding
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (22:40): so much violance
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (22:40): or violence
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (22:40): or both
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:52): heh
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:52): ok, i'm down to only a couple of bad characters
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:52): a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3, shepazu, bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350, and "scribe"
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (22:53): is a bad character? o_O
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:53): a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3: there's no way for the script i have to figure out who you are
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (22:53): because my irc nick doesn't map simply to my name?
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:53): yeah
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:53): i even have code which handles "dom"!
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:54): note that collectively sicking+timeless are worse, so don't feel too bad :)
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (22:54): I guess some people like to use irc nicks for minute taking, others like to use initials
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:54): http://pastebin.mozilla.org/1385311 is the script i'm using
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (22:54): hopes aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f can disambiguate CM
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (22:54): (since sometimes people don't use CMN for chaals!)
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:55): http://pastebin.mozilla.org/1385312 is the output
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:55): the script assumes CM is you
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:55): note that the script is purely diagnostic and doesn't actually affect anything
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:56): although potentially we could have the minutes include the output as a suggested reference
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:56): (the script recently grew sufficient intelligence to not get upset by 'jrossi2')
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (22:56): "Alex_Russel" =~ s/$/l/
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:57): thanks
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:57): goes to figure out how many times that messed up
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:57): (twice as a speaker)
bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 (22:59): why do you need to map nick names to real names?
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:59): it helps catch errors
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:59): e.g. missing Present lines
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (22:59): and in this case it helps catch speakers who are misspelled
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:00): there's no requirement to map nick names to real names
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:00): just speaker names to present names
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:00): if you're consistently minuted as Smaug bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 and present as Smaug bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350, that's fine too
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:01): but for people who *don't* know you and weren't at the meeting, if they see both Smaug and Olli in Present+
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:01): they have a perfectly valid reason to think you're distinct people
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:01): (same applies for me)
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:01): a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3: offhand, did any of the other people seem mismapped?
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:03): ponders
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:03): dom: !
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:03): boggles
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:03): Scribe: ArtB
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:03): <ArtB> JR: ....
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:04): anyone know offhand why the scribe.pl script wouldn't map that to "JR:..." ?
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:06): wonky!
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:06): Found Scribe: dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:06): Inferring ScribeNick: scribe
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:06): Found Scribe: dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8ebc
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:06): Inferring ScribeNick: scribe
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:06): Found Scribe: Chaals
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:06): Inferring ScribeNick: chaals
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:07): Found Scribe: ArtB
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:07): Inferring ScribeNick: scribe
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:07): Found Scribe: aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:07): Found Scribe: aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:07): Inferring ScribeNick: aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (23:07): hmm‚Ä¶. this can't be good
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:07): doesn't understand why it sometimes picks the right scribenick and sometimes not
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (23:09): tries to explain to aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f that computers sometimes make their own decisions. "They are not machines, you know."
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:10): heh
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:11): ok, at least one of these is just marcos being sillly
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:11): for the first X minutes he didn't have a Scribe: line
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:11): when he later added a Scribe: line, it was dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8ebc, but his nick was dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:12): as such, the scribe script was definitely going to ignore him
dfefdb66581190514404f57cdf74a8eb (23:12): scribe script won't be the first :(
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:12): to ignore you for cause?
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:14): ok, so, now that i've s///'d the record so that your Scribe: line matches your nick, the scribe system believes you're the scribe
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:15): figures out what the script is thinking
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:15): basically after "Scribe: X", you must speak as X: before scribe: speaks
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:16): otherwise the script decides it's an annotation and ignores it
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:21): chuckles
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:21): a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3: odds are that both of those were CMN :(
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:21): but it looks like they're different people :(
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:23): http://pastebin.mozilla.org/1385325
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:25): oh right
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:25): so, in case any scribes are listening
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:25): "done" is a magic word"
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:25): so you should never write "... done blah blah"
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:25): the scribe scripts will not treat that as a continuation of the previous speaker
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:27): anyone know if AdamBarth was every minuted as AB in webapps?

aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:48): a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 / bb21c722adad611b63dfb48ec99e8350 : can i get you to load the url in http://pastebin.mozilla.org/1385327 in your firefox(nightly, beta, aurora, whatever)?
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (23:49): aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f, ok, loaded
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:49): do the first 6 or so characters' colors disturb you?
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (23:49): the orange "<" is something I think henri is aware of
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:50): oh good
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:58): a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3: any idea who Jakob is?
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:59): context=webapps
aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f (23:59): i suppose it could be jakob.voss
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (00:00): aa99a6e1af27ad37111fe1bad3e0094f, or maybe Jacob Rossi?
